metadata.title: CVE-2022-37454 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The Keccak XKCP SHA-3 reference implementation before fdc6fef has aninteger overflow and resultant buffer overflow that allows attackers toexecute arbitrary code or eliminate expected cryptographic properties. Thisoccurs in the sponge function interface.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.15
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.15

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.15').
pypy3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.3.1+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1').
pysha3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2-4ubuntu0.1').
python3.9 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.6').
